-| wb(wcel(ccom(c0, c1), cbo), wa(wcel(ccom(c0, c1), clo), wcel(cfv(cnop, ccom(c0, c1)), cr)))
-| wcel(c0, cbo)
-| wcel(c1, cbo)
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∘ c1)∈ BndLinOp
⊣ ((c0 ∘ c1)∈ BndLinOp ↔((c0 ∘ c1)∈ LinOp ∧(normop `(c0 ∘ c1))∈ ℝ))
⊣ c0 ∈ BndLinOp
⊣ c1 ∈ BndLinOp

body.origin: |- wb(wcel(ccom(c0, c1), cbo), wa(wcel(ccom(c0, c1), clo), wcel(cfv(cnop, ccom(c0, c1)), cr)))
body.pretty: ⊢ ((c0 ∘ c1)∈ BndLinOp ↔((c0 ∘ c1)∈ LinOp ∧(normop `(c0 ∘ c1))∈ ℝ))

cumulated.origin:
|- wcel(ccom(c0, c1), cbo)
-| wcel(c0, cbo)
-| wcel(c1, cbo)
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∘ c1)∈ BndLinOp
⊣ c0 ∈ BndLinOp
⊣ c1 ∈ BndLinOp

comment: The composition of two bounded linear operators is bounded. (Contributed by NM, 9-Mar-2006.) (New usage is discouraged.)
